intro: Hibbertia charlesii, commonly known as the Charles's hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathland and woodland habitats. Hibbertia charlesii has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. It is a small shrub that can reach up to 1 meter in height.
